The SHACL shape :ItemNameShape applies to all instances of the class schema1:Product, requiring each instance to have exactly one schema1:name property with a string value (xsd:string) of at least 2 characters in length; if not, validation will fail with the message "Each purchased product must have a name with at least 2 characters."

The SHACL shape :ReceiptCurrencyValidationShape applies to all instances of the class schema1:Invoice, specifying that the property schema1:currency must have exactly one value which is either "USD" or "EUR", and if not, the validation will fail with the message "Currency must be either USD or EUR."

The SHACL shape :NotCancelledWithAmountShape applies to all instances of the class schema1:Invoice, requiring that they do not have a schema1:paymentStatus property with a value of "Cancelled", and if such a property is present, validation will fail with the message "Cancelled receipts are not allowed in this context."

The SHACL shape :DigitalOrPhysicalReceiptShape targets all instances of the class schema1:Invoice, requiring that each instance must have either the property schema1:isAccessibleForFree with a value of "true" or the property schema1:deliveryMethod with a value of "Physical", otherwise the validation will fail with the message "Receipts must be either digitally accessible or physically delivered."

The SHACL shape :UnverifiedReceiptExclusionShape targets all instances of the class schema1:Invoice, specifying that they must not have a schema1:paymentStatus property with a value of "Unverified", and if such a property is present, validation will fail with the message "Receipt must not have an unverified payment status."

The SHACL shape :OptionalCommentShape applies to all instances of the class schema1:Invoice, specifying that the property schema1:comment can have zero or more string values (maximum length of 300 characters), with a validation error message "Optional comment must not exceed 300 characters." if the length exceeds 300 characters.

The SHACL shape :LineItemQualifiedCountShape targets all instances of the class schema1:Invoice, enforcing a constraint that each invoice must have at least one schema1:mainEntity property with a value that is an instance of schema1:Product, otherwise the validation will fail with the message "Each receipt must contain at least one valid product line item."

The SHACL shape :ProductNodeShapeEnforcer applies to all instances of the class schema1:Invoice, specifying that each instance must have exactly one schema1:mainEntity property, which in turn must conform to the constraints defined in the :ItemNameShape shape, and if this constraint is not met, validation will fail with the message "Line items in the receipt must satisfy the item naming rules."

The SHACL shape :CourtNameShape targets all instances of the class eli:LegalResource, requiring each instance to have at least one value for the schema1:courtName property, which must be a string, and enforcing that constraint with the validation message "Court name must be provided for each case."

The SHACL shape :VerdictTextShape targets all instances of the class eli:LegalResource, enforcing a constraint on the property schema1:description, requiring its value to be a single string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 20 characters and a maximum length of 1000 characters, and providing the message "Verdict description must be between 20 and 1000 characters" in case of validation failure.

The SHACL shape :CaseTypeShape applies to all instances of the class eli:LegalResource, specifying a single-valued property constraint on schema1:category that requires a value to be one of the following: "Civil", "Criminal", "Administrative", or "Constitutional", with a validation failure message "Case type must be one of Civil, Criminal, Administrative, or Constitutional."

The SHACL shape :JurisdictionShape targets all instances of the class eli:LegalResource, requiring exactly one value for the property schema1:jurisdiction, which must be a string (xsd:string), and producing the message "Jurisdiction must be specified as a string" if this constraint is violated.

The SHACL shape :LegalPartiesShape applies to all instances of the class eli:LegalResource, requiring that each instance has at least two values for the property schema1:about, with a minimum count of 2, and will return a validation error with the message "Each court case must involve at least two legal parties" if this constraint is not met.

The SHACL shape :DocumentLinkShape applies to all instances of the class eli:LegalResource, requiring exactly one schema1:url property with a value that is a valid URI (xsd:anyURI), and will report a validation error with the message "Provide a valid document link as a URI." if this constraint is not met.

The SHACL shape :LanguageShape targets all instances of the class eli:LegalResource, specifying that the dc1:language property must have exactly one value, which must be one of "en", "de", or "fr", with a failure message of "Language must be one of: en, de, or fr."

The SHACL shape :FilingOrHearingDateShape applies to all instances of the class eli:LegalResource, requiring each case to have exactly one of either schema1:dateCreated or schema1:startDate with a date value (xsd:date); if neither property exists or has a non-date value, validation will fail with the message "Each case must have either a filing date or a hearing date."

The SHACL shape :VerdictAndDecisionShape targets all instances of the class eli:LegalResource and specifies a constraint that requires two conditions to be met: the schema1:description property must have a minimum length of 10 characters, and the schema1:dateIssued property must have a value of type date (xsd:date); if either condition is not met, validation will fail with the message "Case must include a verdict and a decision date."

The SHACL shape :QualifiedJudgeRoleShape applies to all instances of the class schema1:Person, requiring them to have at least one schema1:roleName property with the value "Judge", otherwise validation will fail with the message "Person must have the role 'Judge' in a court case."

The SHACL shape :ClosedPropertyShape applies to all instances of the class eli:LegalResource, enforcing a closed set of properties that excludes rdf:type, and specifying that any instances containing additional properties will fail validation with the message "Only allowed properties may be used in a court case resource."

The SHACL shape :LanguageSupportShape applies to all instances of the class eli:LegalResource, requiring the property dc1:language to have exactly one value, which must be either "en" (English) or "de" (German), otherwise validation will fail with the message "Language must be English or German."

The SHACL shape :QualifiedVerdictCountShape applies to all instances of the class eli:LegalResource, requiring at least one schema1:description property with a minimum length of 30 characters, otherwise validation will fail with the message "Case must include at least one detailed verdict."

The SHACL shape :ConsistentJurisdictionCodeShape targets all instances of the class eli:LegalResource, enforcing a single constraint on the property schema1:jurisdiction, requiring its value to be a string matching the pattern "^[A-Z]{2,3}-[A-Z]{2,3}$", representing the format COUNTRY-STATE (e.g., DE-BW), with a validation error message "Jurisdiction code must follow the format COUNTRY-STATE (e.g., DE-BW)" if the constraint is violated.

The SHACL shape :HazardClassShape applies to all instances of the class civic:LabIncident, requiring the property civic:hazardClass to have exactly one value, which must be one of "Chemical", "Biological", "Radiological", or "Mechanical", otherwise validation will fail with the message "Hazard class must be one of: Chemical, Biological, Radiological, Mechanical."

The SHACL shape :LabLocationShape targets all instances of the class civic:LabIncident, enforcing a constraint on the property civic:location, which must have exactly one value that is a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 3 characters, and producing the validation message "Incident location must be specified and at least 3 characters long." if this constraint is violated.

The SHACL shape :InjuryReportedShape applies to all instances of the class civic:LabIncident, requiring exactly one value for the property civic:injuryReported, which must be a boolean (xsd:boolean), and will return the validation message "The injury reported field must be true or false." if the constraint is not met.

The SHACL shape :EmergencyResponseShape applies to all instances of the class civic:LabIncident, requiring the presence of a civic:emergencyResponse property with a value that is a string (xsd:string) of at least 5 characters; if this property is missing or its value is too short, validation will fail with the message: "Emergency response must be provided and contain at least 5 characters."

The SHACL shape :ChemicalNameShape targets all instances of the class civic:LabIncident, enforcing a constraint on the property civic:chemicalInvolved, which must have exactly one value that is a string (xsd:string) with a maximum length of 100 characters, and will produce the validation message "Chemical name must be a string with a maximum of 100 characters." if this constraint is violated.

The SHACL shape :IncidentTimeShape targets all instances of the class civic:LabIncident, enforcing a constraint on the mandatory property civic:incidentTime, which must have exactly one value of type xsd:time in the format hh:mm:ss, with a validation error message "Incident time must be provided in hh:mm:ss format."

The SHACL shape :PhotosAttachedShape applies to all instances of the class civic:LabIncident, enforcing a constraint on the property civic:photosAttached, which must have exactly one value that is a boolean (xsd:boolean), requiring it to be either true or false; if this property violates this constraint, validation will fail with the message: "Photos attached field must be either true or false."

The SHACL shape :ChemicalOrBiologicalHazardShape targets all instances of the class civic:LabIncident, requiring that the property civic:hazardClass has exactly one value, which must be either "Chemical" or "Biological", and validation will fail with the message "Hazard class must be either 'Chemical' or 'Biological'" if this constraint is not met.

The SHACL shape :NoHazardWithoutInjuryShape applies to all instances of the class civic:LabIncident, requiring that if the property civic:hazardClass is present (with a minimum count of 1), then the property civic:injuryReported must have a value other than false; otherwise, the validation will fail with the message "If hazard class is defined, injury must be reported."

The SHACL shape :IncidentNodeNestedHazardShape targets all instances of the class civic:LabIncident, requiring exactly one value for the property civic:hazardDetails that must conform to the constraints defined in the shape :HazardClassificationShape, and will fail validation with the message "Each incident’s hazard detail must match the expected classification rules" if the constraint is not met.

The SHACL shape :CleanupIfPhotosAttachedShape targets all instances of the class civic:LabIncident, and specifies a validation rule with a logical AND constraint, requiring that if the property civic:photosAttached has a value of true, then the property civic:cleanupCompleted must also have a value of true, with a minimum cardinality of one for both properties, and will fail validation with the message "If photos are attached, cleanup must also be completed" if this rule is violated.

The SHACL shape :IncidentTypeOrChemicalShape applies to all instances of the class civic:LabIncident, requiring each incident to have at least one of two properties: civic:incidentType or civic:chemicalInvolved, both with a string value (xsd:string), and producing a validation error with the message "Each incident must specify either a type or a chemical involved" if neither property is specified.

The SHACL shape :PhotosAttachedXORInjuryReportedShape targets all instances of the class civic:LabIncident, enforcing an exclusive OR (XOR) condition between the properties civic:photosAttached and civic:injuryReported, mandating that exactly one of these properties has a value of true, with a validation failure message "Either injury must be reported or photos attached — but not both" if this condition is not met.

The SHACL shape :IncidentAndFollowUpNodeGroup applies to all instances of the class civic:LabIncident, mandating the presence of two properties: civic:incidentDate with a value of type xsd:date, and civic:followUpRequired with a value of type xsd:boolean, with a minimum cardinality of one for each property; if either property is missing, validation will fail with the message "Both incident date and follow-up requirement must be present."

The SHACL shape :FunderNameShape applies to all instances of the class frapo:ResearchGrant, mandating the presence of at least one IRI value for the property frapo:isFundedBy, with a minimum cardinality of 1, and displaying the error message "A funding organization must be associated with the research grant" if this constraint is not met.

The SHACL shape :CurrencyCodeShape applies to all instances of the class frapo:ResearchGrant, requiring them to have exactly one value for the dc1:currency property, which must be one of the following: "EUR", "USD", "GBP", or "JPY", otherwise validation will fail with the message: "Currency must be one of: EUR, USD, GBP, or JPY."

The SHACL shape :ProjectTitleShape applies to all instances of the class frapo:ResearchGrant, requiring exactly one dc1:title property with a string value that has a minimum length of 5 characters, with a validation error message "The project must have a title with at least 5 characters."

The SHACL shape :SubmissionDateShape applies to all instances of the class frapo:ResearchGrant, requiring exactly one dc1:dateSubmitted property with a valid xsd:date value, and will trigger a validation error with the message "Submission date must be provided and valid." if this constraint is not met.

The SHACL shape :PrincipalInvestigatorShape applies to all instances of the class frapo:ResearchGrant, mandating that each instance has exactly one IRI value for the property frapo:hasPrincipalInvestigator, with a validation error message "A principal investigator must be assigned" if this requirement is not met.

The SHACL shape :GrantWebsiteShape applies to all instances of the class frapo:ResearchGrant, requiring exactly one frapo:hasWebsite property with a valid URI (xsd:anyURI) value; if this property is missing or its value is not a valid URI, validation will fail with the message "The grant must provide a valid website URI."

The SHACL shape :GrantStatusShape applies to all instances of the class frapo:ResearchGrant, specifying that the property frapo:hasProjectStatus must have exactly one value, which must be one of the following allowed strings: "Active", "Completed", or "Suspended"; if the value does not match one of these allowed statuses, validation will fail with the message: "Grant status must be one of: Active, Completed, or Suspended."

The SHACL shape :GrantOrFellowshipShape targets all instances of the class frapo:ResearchGrant, mandating that each instance has exactly one value for the property frapo:hasProjectType, which must be either "Grant" or "Fellowship", otherwise validation will fail with the message: "Project type must be either 'Grant' or 'Fellowship'."

The SHACL shape :NoFundingWithoutFunderShape applies to all instances of the class frapo:ResearchGrant, enforcing the constraint that a funding amount (frapo:hasFundingAmount) with a minimum value of 1 and at least one funding agency (frapo:isFundedBy) must be specified; validation will fail with the message "Grants with a funding amount must specify a funding agency" if either of these conditions is not met.

The SHACL shape :ShortOrLongTermShape applies to all instances of the class frapo:ResearchGrant, specifying that the property frapo:hasDuration must have a value of either ≤12 months or ≥36 months; if the duration does not meet either of these conditions, validation will fail with the message "Project must be either short-term (≤12 months) or long-term (≥36 months)".

The SHACL shape :RejectedGrantsMustHaveReasonShape targets all instances of the class frapo:ResearchGrant, requiring that when the evaluation status is "Rejected" (frapo:hasEvaluationStatus), a rejection reason (frapo:hasRejectionReason) must be present at least once, otherwise validation will fail with the message "Rejected grants must include a rejection reason."

The SHACL shape :QualifiedGranteeShape applies to all instances of the class frapo:ResearchGrant, requiring them to have at least one frapo:isHeldBy value that is a named organization or person, specified by having at least one foaf:name value, and validation will fail with the message "Grantee must include at least one named organization or person" if this condition is not met.

The SHACL shape :NegativeFundingDisallowedShape applies to all instances of the class frapo:ResearchGrant, specifying a single mandatory property constraint on frapo:hasFundingAmount, which must have a decimal value (xsd:decimal) greater than or equal to 0.0; if the funding amount is negative, validation will fail with the message "Funding amount cannot be negative."

The SHACL shape :EvaluationScoreOptionalOnlyIfAcceptedShape applies to all instances of the class frapo:ResearchGrant, stipulating that an evaluation score can only be provided (frapo:hasEvaluationScore) if the grant's evaluation status is "Accepted" (frapo:hasEvaluationStatus), and otherwise must not be present; any violations will result in the error message "Evaluation score should only be provided for accepted grants."

The SHACL shape :InstrumentModelShape applies to all instances of the class schema1:MedicalDevice, enforcing a constraint on the property schema1:model, which must be a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 3 characters and a maximum length of 50 characters, with no specified cardinality (i.e., zero or one value is allowed), and producing the validation message "Instrument model must be a string between 3 and 50 characters" if the constraint is violated.

The SHACL shape :ManufacturerNameShape targets all instances of the class schema1:Organization and specifies that each instance must have at least one schema1:name property with a string value, otherwise validation will fail with the message "Manufacturer must have a name".

The SHACL shape :InstrumentTypeShape applies to all instances of the class schema1:MedicalDevice, requiring that the schema1:category property has exactly one value, which must be one of the following predefined categories: "Microscope", "Spectrometer", "Centrifuge", or "Thermocycler", with a validation failure message "Instrument type must be one of the defined categories" if this constraint is not met.

The SHACL shape :HasPowerSourceShape applies to all instances of the class schema1:MedicalDevice, mandating that each instance must have exactly one value for the property schema1:power, which must be a string (xsd:string), otherwise validation will fail with the message: "Each instrument must specify its power source."

The SHACL shape :DeviceStatusShape applies to all instances of the class schema1:MedicalDevice, specifying a single-value property constraint on schema1:status, which must be exactly one of the following allowed strings: "Active", "Inactive", "Under Maintenance", or "Decommissioned", and will return a validation error with the message "Device status must be one of the allowed values" if the constraint is not met.

The SHACL shape :DeviceUsageCountShape applies to all instances of the class schema1:MedicalDevice, mandating the presence of a schema1:usageCount property with a single value of type integer (xsd:integer) that must be a non-negative integer (minimum inclusive 0), and will trigger a validation failure with the message "Usage count must be a non-negative integer." if this constraint is not met.

The SHACL shape :BatteryLifeHoursShape targets all instances of the class schema1:MedicalDevice, enforcing that each instance must have exactly one value for the property schema1:batteryCapacity, which must be a float (xsd:float) within the range of 1 to 72 hours (inclusive), and if this constraint is violated, the validation will produce the message: "Battery capacity must range between 1 and 72 hours."

The SHACL shape :InstrumentIDShape applies to all instances of the class schema1:MedicalDevice, requiring each to have exactly one schema1:identifier property with a string value that matches the pattern "^INST-[0-9]{4,6}$", i.e., "INST-" followed by 4 to 6 digits, and producing the message "Instrument ID must follow the pattern INST-XXXX where X is a digit" if this constraint is violated.

The SHACL shape :NonNegativeUsageCountShape targets all instances of the class schema1:MedicalDevice, mandating a single schema1:usageCount property with a value that is an integer (xsd:integer) with a minimum inclusive value of 0, failing validation with the message "Usage count cannot be negative" if this constraint is not met.

The SHACL shape :SoftwareVersionPatternShape targets all instances of the class schema1:SoftwareApplication, enforcing a single value constraint on the property schema1:softwareVersion, requiring its value to match the pattern "^v[0-9]+\\.[0-9]+(\\.[0-9]+)?$" which represents a semantic versioning pattern, with a failure message "Software version must follow semantic versioning pattern."

The SHACL shape :WarrantyPeriodLimitsShape targets all instances of the class schema1:MedicalDevice, specifying that each instance must have exactly one schema1:warranty property with a numeric value between 0 and 60 (inclusive), and if the value falls outside this range, validation will fail with the message: "Warranty period must be between 0 and 60 months."

The SHACL shape :UniqueSerialNumberShape targets all instances of the class schema1:MedicalDevice and enforces a uniqueness constraint on the property schema1:serialNumber, requiring its values to be unique per language tag, with a cardinality of 1 (one value per language tag), and will produce the message "Serial numbers must be unique per language tag" if this constraint is violated.

"The SHACL shape :ManufacturerNameRequiredShape applies to all instances of the class schema1:Organization, requiring each instance to have at least one schema1:name property with a value, failure to comply will result in a validation error with the message: "Manufacturer organization must have a name.""

The SHACL shape :AssetIDShape applies to all instances of the class schema1:Asset. It specifies a property constraint on schema1:identifier, requiring its value to be a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 8 characters and exactly one occurrence (i.e., cardinality of 1). The value must match the pattern "^ASSET-[0-9]{5}$", i.e., it must start with "ASSET-" followed by exactly 5 digits. If this property does not conform to these constraints, validation will fail with the message: "Asset ID must follow the pattern 'ASSET-12345'."

The SHACL shape :AssetLocationShape targets all instances of the class schema1:Asset, enforcing a constraint on the required property schema1:location, which must have a string value (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 3 characters, failing validation with the message "Asset location must be specified and at least 3 characters" if the property is missing or its value is too short.

The SHACL shape :PurchaseDateShape targets all instances of the class schema1:Asset, requiring exactly one schema1:purchaseDate property with a value of type xsd:date, and returns an error message "Purchase date must be specified" if this property is missing or has a non-date value.

The SHACL shape :AssetOwnerShape applies to all instances of the class schema1:Asset, requiring each asset to have exactly one schema1:owner property with a value that is an IRI, and validation will fail with the message "Each asset must have an owner specified as an IRI" if this constraint is not met.

The SHACL shape :MaintenanceDateShape targets all instances of the class schema1:Asset and requires each of them to have exactly one value for the property schema1:maintenanceDate, which must be a date (xsd:date), otherwise, the validation will produce the message: "Maintenance date must be specified in date format."

The SHACL shape :WarrantyExpirationShape targets all instances of the class schema1:Asset, requiring each to have exactly one value for the property schema1:warrantyExpirationDate, which must be a date (xsd:date), with a validation error message "Warranty expiration date must be specified." if this property is missing or invalid.

The SHACL shape :AssetManufacturerShape applies to all instances of the class schema1:Asset, enforcing a single constraint on the property schema1:manufacturer, which must have exactly one value that is a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 3 characters, and if this constraint is violated, the validation will produce the message: "Manufacturer name must be at least 3 characters long."

The SHACL shape :AssetInsurancePolicyShape targets all instances of the class schema1:Asset, mandating the presence of a schema1:insurancePolicyNumber property with a string value that has a minimum length of 5 characters, and failing validation with the message "Insurance policy number must be specified." if this constraint is not met.

The SHACL shape :WarrantyOrInsuranceShape applies to all instances of the class schema1:Asset, specifying that each asset must have at least one value for either the schema1:warrantyExpirationDate property or the schema1:insurancePolicyNumber property, with a validation failure message "Asset must have either a warranty expiration date or an insurance policy number" if neither property has a value.

The SHACL shape :LocationURIorStringShape applies to all instances of the class schema1:Asset, requiring that the property schema1:location must be exactly one value, which must be either a URI or a string, and if validation fails, it will return the message "Asset location must be either a URI or a string."

The SHACL shape :DepreciationRateRangeShape targets all instances of the class schema1:Asset, requiring them to have exactly one value for the property schema1:depreciationRate, which must be a number within the inclusive range of 0.0 and 0.5; if the value falls outside this range, validation will fail with the message: "Depreciation rate must be between 0.0 and 0.5."
