The SHACL shape :ChildWelfareCaseShape applies to all instances of the class civic:ChildWelfareCase. It specifies two required properties: civic:caseID and civic:isActive. The property civic:caseID must have a string value (xsd:string) that matches the pattern "^CW-\\d{4}$". The property civic:isActive must have a boolean value (xsd:boolean). Both properties are required, and if either is missing or its value is invalid, validation will fail with the message: "Child welfare case must have a valid ID and active status."

Here are the natural language translations for the given SHACL shapes:

The SHACL shape :BuildingPermitShape targets all instances of the class civic:BuildingPermit. It specifies three concurrent property constraints. The property civic:permitID must be a string (xsd:string) that matches the pattern "^BP-\\d{5}$". The property civic:approvalStatus must be a string (xsd:string) with one of the allowed values: "Approved", "Rejected", or "Pending". The property civic:expiryDate must be a date (xsd:date). If any of these constraints are not met, validation will fail with the message: "Building permit must have an ID, status, and expiry date."

The SHACL shape :RoadMaintenanceRecordShape applies to all instances of the class civic:RoadMaintenance. It specifies two concurrent property constraints. The property civic:roadID must be a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 4 characters. The property civic:lastRepairDate must be a date (xsd:date). If either of these constraints is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Road maintenance must include road ID and date of last repair."

The SHACL shape :CensusRecordShape targets all instances of the class civic:CensusRecord. It enforces a constraint that requires the presence of three properties: civic:householdSize with an integer value (xsd:integer) that is at least 1, civic:isUrban with a boolean value (xsd:boolean), and civic:regionCode with a string value (xsd:string) that matches the pattern "^REG-\\d{3}$". If any of these properties are missing or have invalid values, validation will fail with the message: "Census record must include household size, urban status, and region code."

The SHACL shape :LegalAidApplicationShape targets all instances of the class civic:LegalAidApplication. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied simultaneously. The first constraint requires the property civic:applicantIncome to have a value that is a float (xsd:float) greater than or equal to 0.0. The second constraint requires the property civic:caseSeverity to have a value that is one of the following strings: "Low", "Moderate", or "High". If either of these constraints is violated, validation will fail with the message: "Legal aid application must state applicant income and case severity."

The SHACL shape :PublicEventPermitShape targets all instances of the class civic:EventPermit. It enforces three property constraints. The property civic:eventDate must be a date (xsd:date), civic:expectedCrowd must be an integer (xsd:integer) with a minimum value of 1, and civic:eventType must be one of the following strings: "Protest", "Parade", "Festival", or "Concert". All three properties must be present for the validation to succeed. If any of these constraints are not met, the validation will fail with the message: "Event permit must include date, expected crowd, and event type."

The SHACL shape :ResidenceVerificationShape applies to all instances of the class civic:ResidenceVerification. It specifies a validation rule with an sh:or condition, requiring that either the property civic:utilityBillAttached has a value of true (xsd:boolean) or the property civic:leaseAgreementAttached has a value of true (xsd:boolean). If neither of these conditions is met (i.e., neither utility bill nor lease agreement is attached), the validation will fail with the message: "Verification must include a utility bill or lease agreement."

The SHACL shape :EducationGrantShape applies to all instances of the class civic:EducationGrant. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied simultaneously. Firstly, the property civic:grantAmount requires a value that is a float (xsd:float) with a minimum inclusive value of 100.0. Secondly, the property civic:fieldOfStudy requires a value that must be one of the following: "STEM", "Arts", "Law", "Medicine", or "Education". If either of these constraints is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Education grant must define amount (min €100) and field of study."

The SHACL shape :DisabilityBenefitShape applies to all instances of the class civic:DisabilityBenefit. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied simultaneously. The first constraint requires the property civic:disabilityGrade to have a value that is an integer between 10 and 100 (inclusive). The second constraint requires the property civic:monthlySupport to have a value that is a float greater than or equal to 0.0. If either of these properties is missing or has an invalid value, validation will fail with the message: "Disability benefit must include grade (10–100) and monthly support."

The SHACL shape :GreenZoneRegulationShape applies to all instances of the class civic:GreenZoneVehicleAccess. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied simultaneously. The first constraint requires the property civic:emissionClass to have exactly one value, which must be one of the following: "Euro 4", "Euro 5", or "Euro 6". The second constraint requires the property civic:vehicleType to have exactly one value, which must be one of the following: "Car", "Truck", or "Bus". If either of these properties is missing or has a value outside the specified lists, validation will fail with the message: "Green zone access requires emission and vehicle type declaration."

Here are the translated SHACL shapes into natural language documentation sentences:

The SHACL shape :CitizenAppealShape targets all instances of the class civic:CitizenAppeal. It specifies a property constraint that requires two conditions to be met: the value of civic:appealID must be a string that matches the pattern "^APL-\\d{6}$", and the value of civic:appealStatus must be one of the following strings: "Submitted", "InReview", "Resolved", or "Rejected". If either of these conditions is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Citizen appeal must have a valid ID and a recognized status."

The SHACL shape :PublicInternetAccessPointShape applies to all instances of the class civic:PublicWiFi. It specifies a property constraint that requires two conditions to be met: the value of civic:locationID must be a string with a minimum length of 5 characters, and the value of civic:bandwidthMbps must be a float value with a minimum inclusive value of 10.0. If either of these conditions is not met, validation will fail with the message: "Public WiFi record must include location ID and bandwidth (≥10 Mbps)."

The SHACL shape :PublicInfrastructureInspectionShape applies to all instances of the class civic:InfrastructureInspection. It specifies a validation rule with an sh:and condition, requiring the presence of three properties: civic:inspectedItem, civic:lastInspectionDate, and civic:passedInspection. The value of civic:inspectedItem must be one of the following strings: "Bridge", "Tunnel", "Streetlight", or "Pipeline". The values of civic:lastInspectionDate and civic:passedInspection must be a date (xsd:date) and a boolean (xsd:boolean), respectively. If any of these properties are missing or have invalid values, the validation will fail with the message: "Infrastructure record must include item, date, and inspection status."

The SHACL shape :DigitalIdentityVerificationShape targets all instances of the class civic:DigitalIdentity. It enforces a compound constraint that requires two properties to be present and valid. The property civic:linkedEmail must have a value that is a string (xsd:string) conforming to the pattern "^.+@.+\\..+$", and the property civic:twoFactorEnabled must have a value that is a boolean (xsd:boolean). If either of these properties is missing or invalid, the validation will fail with the message: "Digital identity must include a valid email and 2FA setting."

The SHACL shape :ForeignAidProjectShape applies to all instances of the class civic:ForeignAidProject. It specifies two property constraints that must be satisfied simultaneously. The first constraint requires the property civic:recipientCountry to have a value that is a string (xsd:string). The second constraint requires the property civic:fundedAmount to have a value that is a float (xsd:float) with a minimum value of €10,000 (inclusive). If either of these properties is missing or has an invalid value, validation will fail with the message: "Foreign aid must specify a recipient country and a funded amount (≥ €10,000)."

The SHACL shape :YouthProgramEnrollmentShape targets all instances of the class civic:YouthProgram. It specifies two property constraints. The first constraint applies to the property civic:participantAge, requiring its value to be an integer (xsd:integer) within the range of 12 to 25 (inclusive). The second constraint applies to the property civic:programType, requiring its value to be one of the predefined allowed values: "Education", "Sports", "Internship", or "Mentorship". If either of these constraints is violated, validation will fail with the message: "Youth program must include participant age (12–25) and program type."

The SHACL shape :NationalIDValidationShape targets all instances of the class civic:NationalID. It enforces a constraint that combines two conditions: the property civic:idNumber must be a string (xsd:string) with a value that matches the pattern "^NID\\d{8}$", and the property civic:isVerified must be a boolean (xsd:boolean). If either of these conditions is not met, the validation will fail with the message: "National ID must include a valid format and verification status."

The SHACL shape :PublicSurveyResponseShape applies to all instances of the class civic:SurveyResponse. It enforces a constraint that requires the presence of three properties: civic:questionID, civic:answer, and civic:responseTime. The value of civic:questionID must be a string (xsd:string), the value of civic:answer must be a non-empty string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 1 character, and the value of civic:responseTime must be a date and time (xsd:dateTime). If any of these properties are missing or do not meet these conditions, validation will fail with the message: "Survey response must include question ID, answer, and timestamp."

The SHACL shape :GovernmentProcurementShape applies to all instances of the class civic:ProcurementContract. It specifies three property constraints that must be satisfied simultaneously. The first constraint requires the property civic:contractValue to have a value that is a float (xsd:float) with a minimum inclusive value of 1000.0. The second constraint requires the property civic:vendorID to have a value that is a string (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 5 characters. The third constraint requires the property civic:awardDate to have a value that is a date (xsd:date). If any of these properties are missing or do not meet these conditions, validation will fail with the message: "Procurement must include contract value, vendor ID, and award date."

The SHACL shape :DisasterPreparednessPlanShape targets all instances of the class civic:PreparednessPlan. It enforces three simultaneous constraints on the instance data. Firstly, the property civic:planName must have a string value (xsd:string) with a minimum length of 5 characters. Secondly, the property civic:lastUpdated must have a date and time value (xsd:dateTime). Lastly, the property civic:isActive must have a boolean value (xsd:boolean) of true, indicating that the preparedness plan is active. If any of these constraints are not met, validation will fail with the message: "Preparedness plan must be active and include name and last update."

The SHACL shape :TitleShape applies to all instances of the class pub:Title. It enforces a constraint on the property pub:text, requiring its value to be a string (xsd:string). If this property does not conform to this requirement, validation will fail with the message: "Title must be a string."
